user_voice_extracts.text: I have a few hack projects and I'm wondering if any of them might be a good business. I have one i called txtray which allows people to email a document to a GPT and it will create a knowledg graph based on the content I have a project called cursiveGPT where you can use your ipad to write to chatGPT by handwriting and then selecting the text and asking GPT to talk back to you that way, it slows you down and makes your AI LLM use more purposeful. I have a prayer counting app that counts the numbers of prayers you're making up so you can catch up on your islamic missed prayers and keep track. I have a tool that uses the iphone 15's depth camera to make a color striations projection so you can use an iphone and a projector to make a world builder for kids with sand it will project on the sand so when you dig it'll be blue, on surface level it'll be green and on the top it'll be like a mountain brown and then white. The app just colorizes the different depths and offers sliders so you can set the distances. I have a project called parliaments.ai which allows you to create a series of LLMs each with a different mindset and a context for each agent so they can dialog and discuss based on your topic with and without your presence. Which of these ideas might be easy to monetize and turn into a business
user_voice_extracts.context: Opening of conversation - user presents portfolio of projects and seeks guidance on monetization potential
key_phrases: which of these ideas might be easy to monetize

user_voice_extracts.text: What project between all these projects seems like could be something that has a market - identify my skillset and interest area and align it with a market/customer that might make sense for me and then identify the total addressable market and the market I can access easily. I want it to be a side project - not something huge
user_voice_extracts.context: Follow-up question seeking strategic guidance on skill-market alignment
key_phrases: identify my skillset and interest area

user_voice_extracts.text: I want you to review all my ideas and identify some core themes. I don't want to monetize the muslim community, I'm too shy to do that, I'd rather offer it as a gift/service and maybe ask for donations. Otherwise review all my ideas, and identify 3 new monetizable ideas that isn't already on the list and assess them for their pros/cons and then ask me 5 questions to help you identify which business and which beachhead market and what first steps might be best to take
user_voice_extracts.context: Major clarification on values - reveals personal boundary (not monetizing Muslim community), requests theme analysis and new ideas
key_phrases: I don't want to monetize the muslim community
I'm too shy to do that

user_voice_extracts.text: I'm more interested in finding a specific community, makers, diy people, learners, students, are my people, philosophers, permaculture people, I'm not sure which of them has money so i might need to identify some new audience that is parallel to this. I also have a business called Bloom.pm which is a social enterprise that makes technology to help social entrepreneurs organize and act and get out of their way. it's currently an assessment tool that matches people with learning activities, i thought about generalizing it for any learning ecosystem. I also made a badging tool called Bloom Badges that allows people to easily create valid Open Badges 2.0 badges and for a community to offer them to each other as micro-credentials. Another project i have is wayway.ai which is a drawing tool which displays a photo and captures drawing data in order to train a robot to draw like them.
user_voice_extracts.context: Answers Q1 of framework - reveals target communities and additional previously unmentioned projects
key_phrases: makers, diy people, learners, students, are my people

user_voice_extracts.text: 2 lower technical complexity 3. i'd like quick and slow gradual and incremental profits 4. i know diy and maker people in the global innovation gathering 5. practical problems, something that's a pain killer not a vitamin
user_voice_extracts.context: Answers Q2-Q5 of framework - reveals key decision-making criteria

projects.name: Prayer Counting App
projects.description: Tracks missed Islamic prayers to help users catch up and maintain spiritual obligations

projects.user_decision: NOT to monetize - offer as gift/donation instead

projects.name: Bloom Badges

projects.target_market: maker communities, learning communities, DIY enthusiasts, social entrepreneurs
projects.assistant_assessment: best fit for side project: clear market, low technical complexity, existing network access, solves real pain point

projects.name: wayway.ai
